channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Piles of leaves, 5th December
item.description:
The cul de sac on Kingswood drive where houses 10-32 are the steet has not been cleaned for several weeks. There is piles of leaves on both side making it slippery and dangerous for pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Kingswood Drive, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotting leaves causing slip hazard, 5th December
item.description:
Fallen leaves on Holmdene Avenue especially the even numbers side have built up over weeks and now rotted down causing a slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bins on pavement, 5th December
item.description:
Causing obstruction for pedestrians particularly disabled or parents pushing child buggies.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: Overhanging hedge and rubbish, 5th December
item.description:
This is causing there to be zero footpath due to the property owner being inconsiderate to people using the footpath especially with a buggy. The car is not the issue as all cars park like this but their over hanging bush and rubbish should be cleared by them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Breakspears Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slippery pavement, 5th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London

item.title: One way sign missing, 5th December

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leroy Street, Walworth, Greater London

item.title: Causing obstruction to pavement, 5th December
item.description:
This has been reported to you on 2 previous occasions, as you will see from my report in October 25 nothing has been done by the homeowner or you the council. You closed my report before any remedial action had been taken. The attached photo clearly shows zero action to relieve inconvenience to public. It is a hazard as pedestrians are forced close to the lien and this is widely used route for parents and children on route to Poverest School. Is there and possibility that you, the council can do something this time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Forest Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3C, Chalk Pit Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Broken curbing at 44 Stradella Road, 5th December
item.description:
The curbing outside 44 Stradella Road has been broken for several months. This has caused damage to our car tyre while parking and because the slabs are loose it has created a slip hazard as the loose pieces are sometime thrown up on the path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Stradella Road, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned waste bags with sweeped leaves, 5th December

item.title: Continuous dumping of food bags, 5th December
item.description:
Someone is constantly throwing clear food bags on the verges, presumably full of dog food … assuming to feed or poison foxes. I reported this, and the council said the issue was fixed. It isn’t fixed, it’s daily that these plastic bags are being left shredded and all over the verges. There was 5 today. This is a littering issue. Also a danger to wildlife and dogs being walked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roll of beige carpet dumped, 5th December
item.description:
This morning I saw that a roll of beige carpet had been dumped beside a council rubbish bin on Shoulder of Mutton Green. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Street, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree debris, overgrown weeds/ivy, 5th December
item.description:
The trees behind the crash barrier need cutting back, please clear the tree debris that’s been left behind as it’s damaging my fence. Also, the weeds on the back are damaging my fence, please clear them back. I’m having to spend £5800 on a new fence due to damage caused by collapsed bank and trees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downs Hill, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
